item.title: Frederick Health Hit by Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Maryland healthcare provider Frederick Health has taken some of its systems offline in response to a ransomware attack.

The post Frederick Health Hit by Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 27, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 27, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: 152,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Berman & Rabin
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Law firm Berman & Rabin says 152,000 people are impacted by a data breach resulting from a July 2024 ransomware attack.

The post 152,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Berman & Rabin appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Unprotected DeepSeek Database Exposed Chats, Other Sensitive Information
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
An unprotected database belonging to Chinese AI company DeepSeek exposed highly sensitive information, including chat history, secret keys, and backend data.

The post Unprotected DeepSeek Database Exposed Chats, Other Sensitive Information appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Tenable to Acquire Vulcan Cyber for $150 Million
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Tenable plans to acquire exposure management company Vulcan Cyber for roughly $150 million in cash and stock. 

The post Tenable to Acquire Vulcan Cyber for $150 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New Zyxel Zero-Day Under Attack, No Patch Available
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
GreyNoise reports active exploitation of a newly discovered zero-day vulnerability in Zyxel CPE devices. There are no patches available.

The post New Zyxel Zero-Day Under Attack, No Patch Available appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Oligo Raises $50M to Tackle Application Detection and Response
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Oligo Security has raised $50 million in Series B funding for its application detection and response (ADR) platform.

The post Oligo Raises $50M to Tackle Application Detection and Response appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New SLAP and FLOP CPU Attacks Expose Data From Apple Computers, Phones
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
New CPU side-channel attacks named SLAP and FLOP can be exploited to remotely steal data from Apple mobile and desktop devices. 

The post New SLAP and FLOP CPU Attacks Expose Data From Apple Computers, Phones appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Aquabot Botnet Targeting Vulnerable Mitel Phones
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Mirai-based Aquabot botnet has been targeting a vulnerability in Mitel SIP phones for which a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit exists.

The post Aquabot Botnet Targeting Vulnerable Mitel Phones appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Smiths Group Scrambling to Restore Systems Following Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Engineering firm Smiths Group has disclosed a cyberattack that forced it to take some systems offline and activate business continuity plans.

The post Smiths Group Scrambling to Restore Systems Following Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Rockwell Patches Critical, High-Severity Vulnerabilities in Several Products
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Rockwell Automation has released six new security advisories to inform customers about several critical and high-severity vulnerabilities.

The post Rockwell Patches Critical, High-Severity Vulnerabilities in Several Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.
